page.title: 07MOATS IN SAMPFORD
page.content: There are many moats in the Sampfords. There are more moats between Cambridge and Braintree than anywhere else in the country. Nobody thinks that these were used for defensive purposes. I noted they were used to stop livestock escaping from the farm and for the livestocks drinking water. Also the moats could be used for washing water for clothes and for the people themselves. The water from the moats could be used for many other domestic purposes. The earth from the moat would be used for the banks. The moat also enclosed the farm. There are several moats in our rectangle. One is at Gt. Brockholds and another at Ellis Green. Cattle raiding was also popular and the moat ensured that fewer people needed to guard the cattle.
